# Technical Reference

## Supported Formats

| Format | Support | Notes |
|--------|---------|-------|
| JPEG | ✅ Full | Recommended |
| TIFF | ✅ Full | Professional quality |
| PNG | ✅ Full | Web-friendly |

## Storage Locations

```
~/.photo_meta_editor/
├── templates/          # Your template files
├── naming/             # Your naming conventions
└── undo/               # Undo history
```

## Default Templates

Auto-created on first run:
- **Portrait** - Photography template
- **Travel** - Travel photos template
- **Landscape** - Landscape template

## Default Naming Conventions

Auto-created on first run:
- **Basic** - `{original_name}`
- **Dated** - `{date}_{sequence:03d}`
- **Detailed** - `{date}_{camera_model}_{sequence:03d}`

## Metadata Tools

The app auto-detects the best tool:

1. **exiftool** (if installed) - Fastest, recommended
2. **Python fallback** - piexif + Pillow - Always available

Install exiftool:
- macOS: `brew install exiftool`
- Linux: `apt-get install exiftool`
- Windows: Download from [exiftool.org](https://exiftool.org)

## Options

| Option | Purpose |
|--------|---------|
| **Dry Run** | Preview changes before applying |
| **Merge Mode** | Add metadata without overwriting existing |

## Troubleshooting

**"exiftool not found"**
- Install it (see above) or app will use Python fallback

**"Cannot write metadata"**
- Check file permissions
- Ensure file format is supported
- Check disk space

**"Metadata not visible"**
- Different apps show different metadata
- Use "View Metadata" in app to verify

**"Template not loading"**
- Check file location: `~/.photo_meta_editor/templates/`
- Verify JSON syntax is valid
- Restart app

## Testing

```bash
python3 test_app.py
```

Verifies:
- All modules import correctly
- MetadataManager works
- TemplateManager works
- NamingEngine works
- Configuration directories exist

## Dependencies

| Package | Version | Purpose |
|---------|---------|---------|
| PySide6 | 6.7.0+ | GUI |
| piexif | 1.1.3+ | EXIF |
| Pillow | 10.0.0+ | Images |

## Performance

- Small batches (1-10 files): < 1 sec/file
- Medium batches (10-100 files): < 0.5 sec/file (with exiftool)
- Large batches (100+ files): Progressive with tracking
